definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: I double feet hair dint, the Huo ground plays white dress Human body side, the one punch hits to go out.
sentences.chinese: 我双脚发力，霍地弹到白衣人身边，一拳砸出去。

sentences.english: Feet flat on the floor or footrest.
sentences.chinese: 双脚平放在地板或者脚垫上。

sentences.english: As in Tadasana, lengthen and broaden the soles of both feet.
sentences.chinese: 就像在山式，延长和扩展你双脚的脚底。

sentences.english: Not a car road, but the most hair-raising experience you can have on your own two legs.
sentences.chinese: 没有一条汽车可以行使的道路，一切都凭着你的双脚。

sentences.english: Squat with your feet a little less than shoulder distance apart.
Competitors are allowed to touch the first hold(s), without leaving the ground with both their feet.
sentences.chinese: 选手在双脚未离地的情形下，得碰触起攀点。

sentences.english: Those shoes exaggerate the size of his feet.
sentences.chinese: 那双鞋使他的双脚显得过大。

sentences.english: Satan pocketed a bottle and shuffled toward the car.
sentences.chinese: 撒旦将一只瓶子揣进口袋，拖着双脚走向车子。

sentences.english: Our feet crunched on the frozen snow.
sentences.chinese: 我们的双脚嘎吱作响地“踩”着冰冻的雪地。

sentences.english: Keep the patient horizontal with the feet slightly raised.
sentences.chinese: 让病人保持平卧，双脚略微抬高。

sentences.english: Place your feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
sentences.chinese: 将脚平放在地板上，双脚与臀部同宽。

sentences.english: Lengthening and broadening them does not mean tensing them.
sentences.chinese: 延长展宽并不意味着使双脚紧张。

sentences.english: Her feet firmly planted on the tepid rough brick of the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她一双脚稳固地立在微温而粗糙的砖地上。

sentences.english: When the fungus that causes jock itch targets the feet, you have athlete’s foot.
sentences.chinese: 当引发你股癣的真菌感染你的双脚时，你就会得脚气。

sentences.english: Feet slightly wider than the shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 双脚间的距离略宽于双肩。

definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
